blocks.text: Flappy Bird
Libraries used -- Keras
initial number of models = 175
number of models/ generation = 10
model architecture -- [4,7,1]
model inputs -- x coordinate of upper pipe, height of bird, y coordinate of lower pipe, x coordinate of bird
model activation -- [sigmoid,sigmoid]
model loss -- mean squared error
model optimizer -- stochastic gradient descent
1. We initialize 175 models and start training.
2. At every generation we have 10 models.
3. We calculate fitness every generation,
(fitness == 1000*score+total_distance_travelled)
4. we rank models in decreasing order of fitness
5. For next generation, we generate models as follows
a. we send most fit 4 models directly
b. we randomly select 2 models from this 4 models, we
crossover these two models and send the results to next generation
c. we again crossover randomly selected 2 models, but this time we also mutate each of the results
and send them to next generation
d. we repeat the previous process
6. Mutation process-- for a model, we select each of its weights with a probability of 15% and change it randomly between (-0.5,0.5)
7. Crossover process-- We select two models, there are two layers in both models. We set the layer 1 of first model as layer 1 of second model and vice versa.
Problems faced --
1. Genetic Algorithm not converging
reason -- Not sufficient initial models were used, changed the initial number of models from 50 to 175

2. Initially chose only 3 input parameters, i.e x-coordinate difference between bird and pipe, height of bird, height of pipe. But since x coordinate of bird and x-coordinate of pipe were cycling between different values ,had to bring down this parameter and instead add two parameters in it's place i.e x-coordinate of bird and x-coordinate of pipe.
